message:
hello guys .. got an idea of sharing a geeky old days .. I used to program on MSX machines with Basic Language ..
I started the emulator and recorded this video.
hope you like it :)
story: Ahmed Sadek Mohamed Tawfik shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: First Lesson of Animation in MSX
caption: youtube.com
description: How did I learn my first animation using MSX-A170 MSX classified as a home computer .. it has Z80 Processor with 3.58 MHz "Sounds Amazing" the best 8bit proc...

data.message: My first ever computer was Yamaha MSX 150 I got it back 1988, I used to program in LOGO and then BASIC :) the good'ol days

Guys! We need you here
www.facebook.com/retrogameregypt

I have a lot of legacy with this old computer .. I learned how computers work .. and learned assembly language with it .. the thrill to make it faster and faster by any possible mean .. I remember the day when articles was saying cache the sin function in a lookup table .. in the end its resolution was 265x198 points .. 16 color only .. and a huge 32kb maximum ram to fill it. yet the games on it were endless experience :)
I had an apple IIc to learn basic on. Monochrome display and I can't remember how many KB's of RAM. The nostalgia is why I'm collecting every old computer that I can find now.
we could help you score a Sakhr MSX if you want to get back on original hardware and not an emulator...

I already have the AX 170 in the closet .. what I really miss my software source code that were saved on Tapes .. I don't know where did I throw them up :D .. its a nostalgia indeed .. I liked your group :)
lol nowadays you can just connect it to an mp3 player and load/save on mp3 files :) Or like I'm doing here with the ZX spectrum's built-in cassette drive: a car kit!
دخ أنا خربت هيد كاسيتات و انا صغير .. بعدد شعر راسى :D
